com.leapmotion.leap.processing

Class LeapMotion

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.leapmotion.leap.processing.LeapMotion

  • public final class LeapMotion
extends Object
    Leap Motion library for Processing. Usage

    Initialize the Leap Motion library in the setup() method in your sketch 

     LeapMotion leapMotion;

 void setup()
 {
   size(800, 450);
   leapMotion = new LeapMotion(this);
 }

    Then implement zero or more of the methods defined in com.leapmotion.leap.Listener in your sketch; they will be called reflectively by the Leap Motion library. E.g. 

     void onFrame(final Controller controller)
 {
   Frame frame = controller.frame();
   for (Finger finger : frame.fingers())
   {
     // ...
   }
 }

    Alternatively, the controller may be polled in your draw() method, e.g. 

     void draw()
 {
   Controller controller = leapMotion.controller();
   if (controller.isConnected())
   {
     Frame frame = controller.frame();
     for (Finger finger : frame.fingers())
     {
       // ...
     }
   }
 }
    Author:
    Michael Heuer

    • Method Detail

      • controller

        public com.leapmotion.leap.Controller controller()
        Return the controller for this LeapMotion library.

        May be polled in your draw() method, e.g. 

         void draw()
 {
   Controller controller = leapMotion.controller();
   if (controller.isConnected())
   {
     Frame frame = controller.frame();
     for (Finger finger : frame.fingers())
     {
       // ...
     }
   }
 }
        Returns:
        the controller for this LeapMotion library
        Since:
        1.20

      • leapToScreenX

        public float leapToScreenX(float x,
                           float y,
                           float z)
        Return the specified Leap Motion coordinates interpolated linearly to an x value in screen coordindates. Should only be called in a 3D graphics context.
        Parameters:
        x - x value in Leap Motion coordinates
        y - y value in Leap Motion coordinates
        z - z value in Leap Motion coordinates
        Returns:
        the specified Leap Motion coordinates interpolated linearly to an x value in screen coordindates
